alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wilkes County through 600 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fairplains, or over North Wilkesboro, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Ronda... Windy Gap... Mulberry... Buck... and Fairplains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
